rhyme.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a short poem or song, especially for children, using words that rhyme
rhyme.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a collection of traditional rhymes with illustrations
rhyme.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a word that rhymes with another word
rhyme.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Can you think of a rhyme for ‘bicycle’?
rhyme.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: words or lines of poetry that rhyme
rhyme.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I love his use of rhyme and rhythm.
The whole story is written in rhyme.
rhyme.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if two words or lines of poetry rhyme, they end with the same sound, including a vowel
rhyme.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The song has rhyming couplets  (=pairs of lines that end in words that rhyme).
rhyme.translation[1].definitions[0].note: Rhyme is not used in the progressive You say
However, the participle rhyming is used as an adjective
rhyme.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put two or more words together to make them rhyme
